title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/crul.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version crul ropensci/citecorp) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/citecorp.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Please write test(s) changes affect code just docs Push account Submit pull request home base ropensci/citecorp

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Also, check discussion forum

what: Client for the Open Citations Corpus
title: Client for the Open Citations Corpus
text: Client Open Citations Corpus http://opencitations.net/ (OCC) OCC created identifiers called Open Citation Identifiers (oci), e.g., probably going using oci identifiers, rather DOIs /PMIDs /PMCIDs. See ?oc_lookup methods cross-walking among identifier types. ’d like use OpenCitations Sparql endpoint can find http://opencitations.net/sparql

what: COCI: OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI references — oc_coci
title: COCI: OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI references — oc_coci
text: AFAICT API REST wrapper around SPARQL service

title: COCI: OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI references — oc_coci
code: oc_coci_refs(doi, exclude = NULL, filter = NULL, sort = NULL, ...)  oc_coci_cites(doi, exclude = NULL, filter = NULL, sort = NULL, ...)  oc_coci_meta(doi, exclude = NULL, filter = NULL, sort = NULL, ...)  oc_coci_citation(oci, ...)

title: COCI: OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI references — oc_coci
text: doi (character) one Digital Object Identifiers (DOIs) exclude (character) field_name; rows empty value field_name specified removed result set filter =<field_name>:<operator><value>: rows compliant <value> kept result set. parameter <operation> mandatory. <operation> specified, <value> interpreted regular expression, otherwise compared means specified operation. Possible operators "=", "<", ">". instance, filter=title:semantics? returns rows contain string "semantic" "semantics" field title, filter=date:>2016-05 returns rows date greater May 2016. sort =<order>(<field_name>): sort ascending (<order> set "asc") descending (<order> set "desc") order rows result set according values <field_name>. instance, sort=desc(date) sorts rows according value specified field date descending order. ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET oci (character) one Open Citation Identifiers (OCIs)

title: COCI: OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI references — oc_coci
text: data.frame, see http://opencitations.net/index/coci/api/v1 explanation resulting columns

title: COCI: OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI references — oc_coci
text: http://opencitations.net/index/coci/api/v1, https://github.com/opencitations/api-coci

title: COCI: OpenCitations Index of Crossref open DOI-to-DOI references — oc_coci
code: doi1 <- "10.1108/jd-12-2013-0166" doi2 <- "10.1371/journal.pgen.1005937" oci1 <-  "02001010806360107050663080702026306630509-0200101080636102704000806" oci2 <-  "0200101000836191363010263020001036300010606-020010003083604090301050910"  if ( crul::ok( "http://opencitations.net/index/coci/api/v1/references/10.1108/jd-12-2013-0166", timeout_ms = 1000L) ) { try(   oc_coci_cites(doi1),   silent = TRUE ) } #> # A tibble: 34 × 7 #>    timespan  citing                    creation oci   author_sc journal_sc cited #>  * <chr>     <chr>                     <chr>    <chr> <chr>     <chr>      <chr> #>  1 P6Y0M1D   10.7717/peerj-cs.421      2021-03… 0610… no        no         10.1… #>  2 P4Y8M16D  10.3233/ds-190019         2019-11… 0610… no        no         10.1… #>  3 P4Y8M16D  10.3233/ds-190016         2019-11… 0610… yes       no         10.1… #>  4 P3Y10M12D 10.3233/sw-180307         2019-01… 0610… no        no         10.1… #>  5 P1Y0M14D  10.3233/sw-160224         2016-03… 0610… yes       no         10.1… #>  6 P2Y4M     10.1057/s41275-017-0070-x 2017-08  0610… no        no         10.1… #>  7 P2Y11M20D 10.7287/peerj.preprints.… 2018-03… 0611… no        no         10.1… #>  8 P1Y11M5D  10.1101/108480            2017-02… 0613… no        no         10.1… #>  9 P3Y10M29D 10.59350/zcrhs-r7h02      2019-02… 0613… no        no         10.1… #> 10 P2Y       10.1007/978-3-030-01379-… 2018     0615… yes       no         10.1… #> # ℹ 24 more rows  ### More examples if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # references oc_coci_refs(doi1, exclude = "oci") oc_coci_refs(doi1, filter = "date:>2016-05", verbose = TRUE) oc_coci_refs(doi2) oc_coci_refs(c(doi1, doi2))  # citations oc_coci_cites(doi1, exclude = "oci") oc_coci_cites(doi2) oc_coci_cites(c(doi1, doi2))  # metadata oc_coci_meta(doi2) oc_coci_meta(c(doi1, doi2))  # citation - an OCI instead of a DOI oc_coci_citation(oci1) oc_coci_citation(c(oci1, oci2)) } # }

title: Methods for getting IDs from other IDs — oc_lookup
Methods for getting IDs from other IDs — oc_lookup
text: id One digital object identifiers (DOI), PMID, PMCID, depending function ... curl options passed crul::verb-GET

title: Methods for getting IDs from other IDs — oc_lookup
text: data.frame, four columns: doi: digital object identifier pmid: pubmed identifier pmcid: pubmed central identifier paper: open citations corpus url empty data.frame (columns rows) results found Column order always ; note though columns may missing , example, PMID DOI search.

title: Methods for getting IDs from other IDs — oc_lookup
code: if (oc_lookup_check()) { try(   oc_doi2ids("10.1097/igc.0000000000000609", timeout_ms=10),   silent = TRUE ) }  ### More examples if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ oc_doi2ids('10.1093/biomet/80.3.527') oc_doi2ids('10.1093/biomet/79.3.531') oc_pmid2ids("31857888") oc_pmcid2ids("PMC6422012")  oc_doi2ids(id = oc_dois[1:3]) oc_pmid2ids(id = oc_pmids[1:3]) oc_pmcid2ids(id = oc_pmcids[1:3]) } # }

title: citecorp 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-04-16

title: citecorp 0.3.0
text: oc_coci_refs(), oc_coci_cites(), oc_coci_citation() now support one DOI COCI identifier passed . oc_coci_meta() already supported one identifier; now four oc_coci* methods support one identifier. caveat API route behindn oc_coci_meta() supports >1 identifier single http request - whereas API routes behind functions support one identifier per request, make http request identifier passed (#6)

title: citecorp 0.3.0
text: added tests Cloudflare http status codes (#7)

title: citecorp 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-09

title: citecorp 0.2.2
text: better check http requests work running examples require http requests (#5)

title: citecorp 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-11-07

title: citecorp 0.2.0
text: functions oc_doi2ids, oc_pmid2ids, oc_pmcid2ids (see ?oc_lookup) now accept 1 identifier. underlying SPARQL queries modified make possible. (#1) three new package datasets (oc_dois, oc_pmids, oc_pmcids) vectors identifiers types testing examples

title: citecorp 0.2.0
text: fixed error parsing results oc_lookup functions - fix later changed part another fix, still appreciated (#2) (#3) thanks @Selbosh fix parsing oc_lookup functions: retrieve data.frame columns exist - prevents error retrieving column doesn’t exist (#4) thanks @Selbosh
